title: Understanding Place Structure
goal: Deeply understand that each gismu has a fixed place structure with numbered slots.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Week 3 review — answer these questions:

1. xu do gleki        → ? (answer yes)
2. xu ti mlatu        → ? (answer no, it's a dog)
3. How do you say 47? → ?

(Answers: go'i, na go'i .i ti gerku, vo ze)

New Material (5-7 min)

The Place Structure Blueprint

mi klama la .paris. la .london. — I go to Paris from London.

You've been using place structures since Week 1. Today we go deeper. Every gismu has a fixed blueprint — numbered slots (x1, x2, x3...) with specific meanings.

klama: A Five-Place Gismu

Let's examine klama in full:

klama — x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 using x5
        │         │       │       │        │
        goer    dest   origin  route   vehicle

Each slot has a specific role:

  • x1: the goer (who goes)
  • x2: the destination (where to)
  • x3: the origin (where from)
  • x4: the route (which way)
  • x5: the vehicle (by what means)

Filling Places Left to Right

When you build a sentence, sumti fill places in order:

Sentence x1 x2 x3 x4 x5
mi klama mi — — — —
mi klama la .paris. mi la .paris. — — —
mi klama la .paris. la .london. mi la .paris. la .london. — —

The first sumti after the selbri is x2. The second is x3. And so on.

Examples with Multiple Places

Lojban x1 x2 x3 English
mi klama la .paris. I Paris — I go to Paris.
mi klama la .paris. la .london. I Paris London I go to Paris from London.
la .bob. cu klama la zdani la .paris. Bob home Paris Bob goes home from Paris.

Why This Matters

You can't randomly place sumti. The order determines meaning:

Lojban Meaning
mi klama la .paris. la .london. I go to Paris from London.
mi klama la .london. la .paris. I go to London from Paris.

Same words, opposite meanings — because x2 and x3 swapped.

Comparing Place Structures

Different gismu have different structures:

Gismu Places Structure
prami 2 x1 loves x2
tavla 4 x1 talks to x2 about x3 in language x4
klama 5 x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 by x5

You must learn each gismu's structure. There's no shortcut.

Key Point

Every gismu has a fixed place structure. Sumti fill places left to right. The order matters — swapping positions changes the meaning.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Identify the Places

For mi klama la .paris. la .london., identify:

  1. What is x1? →
  2. What is x2? →
  3. What is x3? →
Answers
  1. mi (the goer)
  2. la .paris. (the destination)
  3. la .london. (the origin)

Exercise 2: Fill the Structure

Using klama (x1 goes to x2 from x3), translate to Lojban:

  1. You go to London.
  2. Alice goes to Paris.
  3. I go to Tokyo from London.
  4. Bob goes home from Paris.
Answers
  1. do klama la .london.
  2. la .alis. cu klama la .paris.
  3. mi klama la .tokios. la .london.
  4. la .bob. cu klama la zdani la .paris.

Exercise 3: Decode the Sentence

What does each sentence mean? Identify x1, x2, x3.

  1. la .meris. cu klama la zdani
  2. do klama la .paris. la .tokios.
  3. mi klama la .london. la zdani
Answers
  1. Mary goes home. (x1=Mary, x2=home)
  2. You go to Paris from Tokyo. (x1=you, x2=Paris, x3=Tokyo)
  3. I go to London from home. (x1=I, x2=London, x3=home)

items.text: I go to Tokyo from London.

items.answer: You go to Paris from Tokyo. (x1=you, x2=Paris, x3=Tokyo)
I go to London from home. (x1=I, x2=London, x3=home)

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I go to Paris." → mi klama la .paris.
  2. "I go to Paris from London." → mi klama la .paris. la .london.
  3. "Bob goes home from Tokyo." → la .bob. cu klama la zdani la .tokios.

Now make up your own: where do you go? Where from?

Today's Vocab

No new gismu today — focus on the concept.

Key concept:

Term Meaning
place structure the fixed blueprint of slots (x1, x2, x3...) for a gismu
filling places sumti fill places in order, left to right

klama reference:

klama — x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 using x5

Summary

You learned that every gismu has a fixed place structure with numbered slots. Sumti fill these slots left to right: x1 before the selbri, then x2, x3, etc. after. The order matters — klama la .paris. la .london. means "go to Paris from London," not the reverse.

Tomorrow preview: You'll learn three two-place gismu — viska (see), tirna (hear), and penmi (meet) — and practice filling both places.
